snippet: With same-sex marriage endorsed in several states, and the election of the nation’s first openly lesbian senator, advocates celebrated victories “across the board and across the country.”
abstract: Gay rights advocates savor multiple victories in latest national election, with wins for same-sex marriage in Maine, Maryland and Minnesota, election in Wisconsin of Tammy Baldwin, nation’s first openly gay senator, and re-election of President Obama, who took risk by endorsing same-sex marriage.

byline.contributor: Emmarie Huetteman contributed reporting from Baltimore.

lead_paragraph: With same-sex marriage endorsed in several states, and the election of the nation’s first openly lesbian senator, advocates celebrated victories “across the board and across the country.”

headline.seo: Gay Rights Advocates Celebrate Multiple Victories
headline.main: As Victories Pile Up, Gay Rights Advocates Cheer ‘Milestone Year’
headline.print_headline: As Victories Pile Up, Gay Rights Advocates Cheer ‘Milestone Year’

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
